column3:
Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/abda1da7bee94ebd0f70ccb3ea4a2896513e53c3 for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in contrib/tes
PEBKAC. To build without UPnP support, you need USE_UPNP=- as documented. USE_UPNP=0 means it's compiled but disabled by default.\n

Hmm, would you be opposed to adding a comment in the makefile clarifying that? I see it in /doc/build-unix.txt now, but I think most people would just read /INSTALL and /README and if nothing special was mentioned there expect 'make' to build the thing.

Also, why is libupnp linked by default? The average person looking to build this would very likely not have that on their machine, no?

More comments can't hurt, at least.

miniupnpc is a pretty standard part of most desktop OS these days, at least.
